class discord.ActionRow¶

Represents an ActionRow-Part for the components of an discord.Message.

Read more in the Documentation

Parameters

  • *components (*Union[Button, SelectMenu]) – The components the ActionRow should have. It could contain at least 5 Button, or 1 SelectMenu.

  • note :: (.) – For more information about ActionRow’s visit the Discord-API Documentation.

__init__(*components)¶

Initialize self. See help(type(self)) for accurate signature.

add_component(component)¶

Adds a component to the ActionRow and returns the action row.

Parameters

component (Union[Button, SelectMenu]) – The component to add to the ActionRow.

:param : :type : return: discord.ActionRow

insert_component_at(index, component)¶

Inserts a component before a specified index to the ActionRow and returns the action row.

Parameters

  • index (int) – The index of where to insert the component.

  • component (Union[Button, SelectMenu]) – The component to insert.

:param : :type : return: discord.ActionRow

set_component_at(index, component)¶

Modifies a component to the ActionRow. and returns the action row.

The index must point to a valid pre-existing component.

Parameters

  • index (int) – The index of the component to modify.

  • component (Union[Button, SelectMenu]) – The component to replace the old one with.

Raises

  • IndexError – An invalid index was provided.

  • :return – discord.ActionRow:

disable_component_at(index)¶

Disables the component at the specified position and returns the action row.

Parameters

index (int) – The position of the component to be deactivated in the ActionRow.

Raises

  • IndexError – The specified index is outside the length of the actionRow.

  • :return – discord.ActionRow:

add_components(*components)¶

Adds multiple components to the ActionRow.

Parameters

*components (*Union[Button, SelectMenu]) – The components to add to the ActionRow.

:param : :type : return: discord.ActionRow

disable_all_components()¶

Disables all component’s in this ActionRow and returns the action row.

Returns

discord.ActionRow

disable_all_components_if(check, *args)¶

Disables all components in this ActionRow if the passed check returns True. It returns the action row.

Parameters

  • check (Union[bool, typing.Callable]) – Could be a bool or usually any Callable that returns a bool.

  • *args (Any) – Arguments that should be passed in to the check if it is a Callable.

:param : :type : return: discord.ActionRow

disable_all_buttons()¶

Disables all :discord.Button’s in this ActionRow and returns the action row.

Returns

discord.ActionRow

disable_all_buttons_if(check, *args)¶

Disables all discord.Button’s in this ActionRow if the passed check returns True. It returns the action row.

Parameters

  • check (Union[bool, typing.Callable]) – Could be a bool or usually any Callable that returns a bool.

  • *args (Any) – Arguments that should be passed in to the check if it is a Callable.

:param : :type : return: discord.ActionRow

disable_all_select_menus()¶

Disables all discord.SelectMenu’s in this ActionRow and returns the action row.

Returns

discord.ActionRow

disable_all_select_menus_if(check, *args)¶

Disables all SelectMenu’s in this ActionRow if the passed check returns True. It returns the action row.

Parameters

  • check (Union[bool, typing.Callable]) – could be an bool or usually any Callable that returns a bool

  • *args (Any) – Arguments that should be passed in to the check if it is a Callable.

:param : :type : return: discord.ActionRow

classmethod from_dict(data)¶

Internal method to create a discord.ActionRow from the data given by discord.

Parameters

data (dict) – The raw data from the api.

Returns

The ActionRow created.

discord.ActionRow

Button¶

Methods
  • def__init__
  • defdisable_if

class discord.Button¶

Represents an Discord-Button

Read more in the Documentation

Parameters

  • label (Optional[str] = None) – text that appears on the button, max 80 characters

  • custom_id (Optional[Union[str, int]] = None) – a developer-defined identifier for the button, max 100 characters

  • style (Optional[Union[ButtonStyle, int]] = ButtonStyle.grey) – The Style the Button should have

  • emoji (Optional[Union[discord.PartialEmoji, discord.Emoji, str]] = None) – The Emoji that will be displayed on the left side of the Button.

  • url (Optional[str]) – a url for link-style buttons

  • disabled (Optional[bool] = False) – whether the button is disabled (default False)

__init__(label=None, custom_id=None, style=<ButtonStyle.grey: 2>, emoji=None, url=None, disabled=False)¶

Initialize self. See help(type(self)) for accurate signature.

set_label(label)¶

Sets the Label of the Button

Parameters

label – str The label to replace th old one with.

Returns

discord.Button

set_url(url)¶

Sets the url of the Button

url: str

The url to replace the old one with

Returns

discord.Button

set_custom_id(custom_id)¶

Sets the custom_id of the Button

Parameters

custom_id – Union[str, int] The custom_id to replace the old one with

Returns

discord.Button

disable_if(check, *args)¶

Disables the discord.Button if the passed check returns True.

Parameters

  • check (Union[bool, typing.Callable]) – The check could be an bool or usually any Callable that returns an bool.

  • *args (Any) – Arguments that should be passed in to the check if it is an Callable.

:param : :type : return: discord.Button

set_style_if(check, style, *args)¶

Sets the style of the Button to the specified one if the specified check returns True.

Parameters

  • check (Union[bool, typing.Callable]) – The check could be an bool or usually any Callable that returns an bool

  • style (discord.ButtonStyle) – The style the Button should have when the check returns True

  • *args (Any) – Arguments that should be passed in to the check if it is an Callable.

:param : :type : return: discord.Button

SelectMenu¶

Attributes
  • all_option_values
  • not_selected
  • values
Methods
  • def__init__
  • defdisable_if
  • defset_custom_id
class discord.SelectMenu¶

Represents a Select-Menu

Read more in the Documentation

Parameters

  • custom_id (str or int) – A developer-defined identifier for the SelectMenu, max. 100 characters.

  • options (List[SelectOption]) – A list of choices(SelectOption) the SelectMenu should have, max. 25.

  • placeholder (Optional[str] = None) – Custom placeholder text if nothing is selected, max. 100 characters.

  • min_values (Optional[int] = 1) – The minimum number of items that must be chosen; default 1, min. 0, max. 25.

  • max_values (Optional[int] = 1) – The maximum number of items that can be chosen; default 1, max. 25.

  • disabled (Optional[bool] ) = False) – disable the SelectMenu, default False

__init__(custom_id, options, placeholder=None, min_values=1, max_values=1, disabled=False)¶

Initialize self. See help(type(self)) for accurate signature.

all_option_values¶

All values of the options

If the value is a number it is returned as an integer, otherwise as string

Note

This is equal to

for option in self.options:
    if option.value.isdigit():
        yield int(option.value)
    else:
        yield option.value
values¶

The options that were selected

Note

This only exists if the SelectMenu is passed as a parameter in an interaction.

If the value is a number it is returned as an integer, otherwise as string

Returns

List[Union[int, str]]

not_selected¶

The options that were not selected

Note

This only exists if the SelectMenu is passed as a parameter in an interaction.

If the value is a number it is returned as an integer, otherwise as string

Returns

List[Union[int, str]]

set_custom_id(custom_id)¶

Set the custom_id of the SelectMenu

:param : The custom_id to replace the old one with :type : param custom_id: Union[str, int] :param : :type : return: discord.SelectMenu

disable_if(check, *args)¶

Disables the discord.SelectMenu if the passed check returns True.

Parameters

  • check (Union[bool, typing.Callable]) – The check could be an bool or usually any Callable that returns an bool.

  • *args (Any) – Arguments that should be passed in to the check if it is an Callable.

:param : :type : return: discord.SelectMenu

SelectOption¶

Methods
  • def__init__
class discord.SelectOption¶

A class that creates an option for a SelectMenu and represents it in a SelectMenu in the components of a discord.Message.

Read more in the Documentation

Parameters

  • label (str) – the user-facing name of the option, max 25 characters

  • value (str) – the dev-define value of the option, max 100 characters

  • description (Optional[str] = None) – an additional description of the option, max 50 characters

  • emoji (Union[PartialEmoji, Emoji, str] = None) – an Emoji that will be shown on the left side of the option.

  • default (Optional[bool] = False) – will render this option as selected by default

__init__(label, value, description=None, emoji=None, default=False)¶

Initialize self. See help(type(self)) for accurate signature.

Modal¶

Methods
  • def__init__
class discord.Modal¶

Represents a Discord Modal

Parameters

  • custom_id (str) – A developer-defined identifier for the component, max 100 characters

  • title (str) – The title of the popup modal, max 45 characters

  • components (List[Union[ActionRow, List[TextInput], TextInput]]) – Between 1 and 5 (inclusive) components that make up the modal.

__init__(title, custom_id, components)¶

Initialize self. See help(type(self)) for accurate signature.

TextInput¶

Methods
  • def__init__
class discord.TextInput¶

Represents an Discord-TextInput <https://discord.com/developers/docs/interactions/message-components#text-inputs>`_

Read more in the Documentation

Parameters

  • custom_id (Optional[Union[str, int]]) – A developer-defined identifier for the input, max 100 characters

  • style (Optional[Union[TextInputStyle, int]] = TextInputStyle.short) – The Style of the TextInput; so single- or multi-line

  • label (str) – The label for this component, max 45 characters

  • min_length (Optional[int]) – The minimum input length for a text input, min 0, max 4000

  • max_length (Optional[int]) – The maximum input length for a text input, min 1, max 4000

  • required (Optional[bool] = True) – Whether this component is required to be filled, default True

  • value (Optional[str]) – A pre-filled value for this component, max 4000 characters

  • placeholder (Optional[str]) – Custom placeholder text if the input is empty, max 100 characters

__init__(label, custom_id, style=1, min_length=None, max_length=None, required=True, value=None, placeholder=None)¶

Initialize self. See help(type(self)) for accurate signature.
